title: Terence Lewis (choreographer)
text:
Terence Lewis (born 10 April 1975) is an Indian dancer and choreographer, specialising in <a href="contemporary%20dance">contemporary dance</a>. He is known as a choreographer and judge in reality dance series "<a href="Dance%20India%20Dance">Dance India Dance</a> season <a href="Dance%20India%20Dance%23Season%201">1</a>, <a href="Dance%20India%20Dance%23Season%202">2</a> & <a href="Dance%20India%20Dance%23Season%203">3</a>" (2009–2012) He runs his 'Terence Lewis Contemporary Dance Company' in Mumbai, holds dance workshops both in India and abroad. He has choreographed Bollywood films like, "<a href="Lagaan">Lagaan</a>" (2001), "<a href="Jhankaar%20Beats">Jhankaar Beats</a>" (2003) and "<a href="Goliyon%20Ki%20Raasleela%20Ram-Leela">Goliyon Ki Raasleela Ram-Leela</a>" (2013), apart from musicals, stage shows, ads, music videos and national and international dance competitions, as well as starring in a music video for "DJ Hot Remix Vol.3" called Badan Pe Sitare (Remix of old song by Harry Anand) He was a judge of "<a href="Nach%20Baliye%205">Nach Baliye 5</a>", along with actress <a href="Shilpa%20Shetty">Shilpa Shetty</a> and film director <a href="Sajid%20Khan%20%28director%29">Sajid Khan</a>. And seen judging <a href="Nach%20Baliye%20Shriman%20v/s%20Shrimati">Nach Baliye Shriman v/s Shrimati</a> along with actress and "Nach Baliye 5" judge Shilpa Shetty and film director and choreographer <a href="Farah%20Khan">Farah Khan</a>. Terence Lewis also got Staar Parivaar Award for Favourite Judge. He also choreographed Disney India's first theatre production Beauty and the Beast. Presently he is one of the judges of India's Best Dancer. He recently came up with his first music video "Tenu Meri Umar Lag Jaave" by Rahul Jain.
Early life and training.
Terence Lewis was raised in Mumbai in a <a href="Tamil%20Catholics">Mangalorean Catholic</a> family of Javier Lewis and Teresa Lewis, Lewis is youngest of eight siblings. He studied and started dancing in <a href="St.%20Theresa%27s%20Boys%20High%20School">St. Theresa's Boys High School</a>, and St. Xavier's college, Mumbai. He is graduated from <a href="IHM%20Mumbai">IHM Mumbai</a> formerly known as Dadar Catering College. He is trained in <a href="jazz">jazz</a>, <a href="ballet">ballet</a> and contemporary dance at the <a href="Alvin%20Ailey%20American%20Dance%20Theater">Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater</a> and the <a href="Martha%20Graham%20Center%20of%20Contemporary%20Dance">Martha Graham Center of Contemporary Dance</a> in New York.
Career.
Lewis is a choreographer in Bollywood films and musicals, stage shows, ads and music videos. He has choreographed a number of films and musicals as a choreographer. Lewis has choreographed a number of stage shows, Indian contemporary performances, Bollywood Shows, corporate launches, Broadway Westend musicals, feature films, several popular music videos, and has appeared in advertisements. Lewis won the 2002 <a href="American%20Choreography%20Award">American Choreography Award</a> for his choreography for songs of the movie "Lagaan" along with <a href="Saroj%20Khan">Saroj Khan</a>, <a href="Raju%20Khan">Raju Khan</a>, <a href="Ganesh%20Hegde">Ganesh Hegde</a> and <a href="Vaibhavi%20Merchant">Vaibhavi Merchant</a>.
He has choreographed international stage shows, Bollywood shows, corporate launches, Broadway Westend musicals, feature films, ads and music videos. He is the first Indian to receive the <a href="danceWEB%20Europe">danceWEB Europe</a> Scholarship, representing India in <a href="Vienna">Vienna</a>, Austria. He's currently a judge in the same celebrity couple dance competition but its sixth season.
Dance India Dance.
Terence Lewis has been a judge on "<a href="Dance%20India%20Dance">Dance India Dance</a>" for its past two seasons. In <a href="Dance%20India%20Dance%23Season%201">the first season</a>, he and his contestant, <a href="Alisha%20Singh">Alisha Singh</a>, came in second place, in the second season, his contestant <a href="http%3A//danceindiadance.in/news/2010/dance-india-dance-season-2-winner-shakti-mohan/">Shakti Mohan</a> won the contest. In <a href="Dance%20India%20Dance%23Season%203">the third season</a>, his contestant, <a href="Pradeep%20Gurung">Pradeep Gurung</a>, came in second place behind <a href="Rajasmita%20Kar">Rajasmita Kar</a>.
In the third season of "<a href="Dance%20India%20Dance">Dance India Dance</a>", Lewis is still part of the judging panel along with <a href="Remo%20D%27Souza">Remo D'Souza</a> and <a href="Geeta%20Kapoor">Geeta Kapoor</a>. The most shocking event to happen during the season 3 auditions was the participation of his former assistant, who did so without informing Lewis. Lewis did not judge his performance and left it to the other two judges, who selected him for the next round regardless.
Fear Factor-Khatron Ke Khiladi (Level 3).
Lewis was the contestant of the of Colors TV's <a href="Fear%20Factor%20-%20Khatron%20Ke%20Khiladi">Fear Factor - Khatron Ke Khiladi</a> anchored by <a href="Priyanka%20Chopra">Priyanka Chopra</a>. Lewis chose as his partner, and she is from <a href="Indore">Indore</a>/<a href="New%20Delhi">New Delhi</a>, studying engineering from Indore and schooled from Air Force Bal Bharti School, New Delhi. The 3rd Level for 13 New Boys was held in <a href="Copacabana%20%28Rio%20de%20Janeiro%29">Copacabana</a>, <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>. He was eliminated in the 11th Episode.
Filmography.
He has done more than 25 movies and musical albums. Lewis is well known for his work on <a href="Lagaan">"Lagaan: Once Upon a Time in India"</a>, "<a href="Goliyon%20Ki%20Raasleela%20Ram-Leela">Goliyon Ki Raasleela Ram-Leela</a>" and <a href="Gold%20%282018%20film%29">"Gold"</a>.
In 2020, a biopic documentary about his own life "Terence Lewis, Indian Man" directed by the French director Pierre X. Garnier will be released.
